alert.note: Alert for Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 2:03PM CDT until June 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, Deaf Smith, Oldham, Potter and Randall. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 PM CDT, flood waters continue to keep certain areas and roads closed. - Additional rainfall through the week may be possible. Any additional rainfall could quickly lead to additional flooding issues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Umbarger, Bushland, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Palo Duro Canyon and Timbercreek Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
